summary: Tony Stark is a Pinterest Mom
body:
Tony Stark is a Pinterest Mom

-After Endgame, when he’s retired, he’s trying to figure out a hobby to replace being Iron Man.

-And then May Parker, this wonderful woman, introduces him to Pinterest.

-May is the QUEEN of DIY. She’s been a single mom for a few years now, and even before then, Ben wasn’t really super handy. So if the dishwasher broke, she just pulled up Google and learned how to fix it and then she fixed it.

-So when May introduces Tony to the DIY side of Pinterest, he picks a few things for fun and just starts making stuff.

-And May texts him links to projects saying “I bet I can do this better than you.” And it. Is. On.

-And they just send each other links and challenge each other and yeah, Tony has a bit of an advantage because money, but May’s been doing this for YEARS now. She may not be able to cook, but she can make anything out of anything.

-And like…Tony doesn’t really have a use for this stuff after it’s done, and he’s not a sentimental man, so he usually gives his finished product to the Parkers(occasionally to other friends, or he keeps it to give to Morgan, but May’s his Pinterest buddy so she gets most of his stuff).

-But since they so often do the same projects, the Parker household starts to overflow with duplicates of Pinterest DIY stuff, and Peter’s a little scared.

-Tony comes over to the Parkers’ a lot more because of this, and one day Pepper and Rhodey and Happy come over as well, and one of them makes an off-comment about there needing to be more chairs and May and Tony share A Look and Peter fears for his life because “we can’t fit another 18 chairs in this apartment there literally isn’t enough room.”

-“Yes there is Peter you’re just a coward.”

-Peter complains about the amount of Pinterest shit in this home but he secretly loves it and does a bit of it himself. I mean, this kid made his own Spider-Man suit and webshooters and dumpster-dives for old technology to fix, of course he does.

-But he’s very lowkey about it because he’s seen what Pinterest has done to Aunt May and Mister Stark. He’s scared to fall down that hole with them.

summary: You know the Queen of Hearts(is always your best bet)
title: You know the Queen of Hearts(is always your best bet)
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2RFVbzO

by Daughter_of_the_TARDIS

It seemed that the key to thriving in the labs of Stark Tower was a combination of knowing who was feeling what - because she had quickly learned that cranky and tired scientists were more likely to blow things up - the ability to deal with complete and utter chaos, and sheer luck. Luckily for her, she had all of those in spades. The main thing that came in handy living with superheroes, she found, were her empathic abilities. Reading the situation, diffusing tensions, knowing when someone was lying about being hurt - it all came in handy in Avengers Tower.

Words: 920, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

Series: Part 2 of Strange Families

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Thor (Movies), X-Men - All Media Types
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Darcy Lewis, Remy LeBeau, Logan (X-Men), Kitty Pryde, Jubilation Lee, Jane Foster (Marvel), Tony Stark, Pepper Potts, Avengers Team (MCU)
  • Relationships: Remy LeBeau/Darcy Lewis, Jane Foster & Darcy Lewis, Darcy Lewis & Jubilation Lee & Kitty Pryde, Darcy Lewis & Avengers Team, Pepper Potts/Tony Stark

summary: A Tribute to the Dark - Soroka - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
title: A Tribute to the Dark - Soroka - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Summary:

It is said among Asgardians, ‘Go not to the Norns for answers, for you may not live to hear them.’

The Water of Sight takes its toll on Thor. Tony is the first person on the team to learn exactly how much.

Relationships: Tony Stark & Thor

Additional tags: Tony Stark & Thor Friendship, Hurt Thor (Marvel), Thor (Marvel) Feels, Worried Tony Stark, Tony Stark Has A Heart, Blood and Injury, Hurt/Comfort, Angst and Humor, Aftermath of Violence

I love the smell of a new Ironthunder fic. Smells like petrichor. And machine oil.

If you liked it, author says put a review on it.

blog.description:
Master of the Mystic Arts.
Ask and roleplay blog. 
MCU and other fandoms.

summary:
Tony: I was thinking we could go out for a drink sometime?
Stephen: Sorry, I can’t. *walks out of room*
Tony:
Peter: Press ‘F’...
body:
Tony: I was thinking we could go out for a drink sometime?

Stephen: Sorry, I can’t. *walks out of room*

Tony:

Peter: Press ‘F’ to pay respects.

Tony: Peter, I swear to God-

Peter: S- Sorry Mr. Stark!

Tony: He’ll be definitely dating me in the future, just wait and see.

Artist(s): Daniel Acuña, Steve McNiven, Andrea Sorrentino.

tags: this was waaaaaay back in my drafts
summary:
Peter, experiencing a mild inconvenience: I am going to YEET myself off a cliff
Tony: ???
Peter, to Shuri: if you mix vaguely...
body:
Peter, experiencing a mild inconvenience: I am going to YEET myself off a cliff

Tony: ???

Peter, to Shuri: if you mix vaguely suicidal comments with teenage slang, it like cancels out and confuses the adults and they don’t know whether to be concerned or confused

summary: Audi May Have Spoiled Who Saves Tony Stark In Avengers 4
title: Audi May Have Spoiled Who Saves Tony Stark In Avengers 4
excerpt: It's hard to believe that Audi may have spoiled who saves Tony Stark in Avengers 4. During a presentation at January 2019's Consumer Electronics Show, Audi a...
description:
Link to a video that talks about a “VR Experience” (ugh) that Marvel announce tying into Endgame. 

Spoiler cut

It is called “Rocket’s Rescue Run.” I am so mad it’s not Pepper’s Rescue Run. I will allow that it does make sense for Rocket to go searching for the space ship that is not the Milano that I can never remember the name of, since he a) knows how to build stuff and b) doesn’t know all his friends are dead.

I would have preferred Pepper or maybe Nebula doing something cool with her cyborg-ness (she never really uses that) to get them home. Why can’t the lady characters do stuff?
